page.title: 20Bredwardine; Home Life.
page.content:
Life in the country is a continual round of activity, most people being concerned with the maintenance of buildings and care of animals in one way or another. Most people keep dogs and many keep cats as well. Many members of the community are keen gardeners. The soil is generally very heavy but also very productive; the climate is generally mild, so that good crops of most vegetables are obtainable. Many properties have pleasant lawns and flower gardens.
This survey was completed by the Bredwardine and Brobury Women's Institute, using a BBC computer loaned by Broadlands C.P. School at Hereford, whose help is gratefully acknowledged.
